author: FelipeDescomplicado
title: Need bricks?
review:
Lot's of bricks! That's the objective, right? 

I got it for brand new bricks, to renew the aspect of my MOCs.

Might be the perfect gift for a pre-school child - as there's a few ideas on the box, a child with no Lego experience will sure apply to it's creativity, so works as fine as getting a blue bucket but it costs half of it.

My ten year old brother enjoyed reproducing the animals showed on the back of the box, with no problems, that's why it's ought for a 5 note.

I don't really think 'playability' really applies for this kind of set, but I can say usually brick-built creations for child are fun as well and usually stud-on-top techniques are pretty solid; the thing it's you can't get out of square shapes with just this set.

It comes with little fw orange and medium blue bricks; it's good they are there, but very sad there's so few of them. The main colours - blue, white, red and yellow  - are the real target.

So, it's great if you're with low budget and in need of just regular bricks. 

*First review I ever done; I'm brazilian, so sorry for the poor English.
